ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to read and write using the Korean alphabet. We also learned basic sentence structures and vocabulary. Now, I can hold a basic conversation.

Elementary understanding/speaking of Korean 

Ability to read and write in Korean
I learned how to speak, write, and understand Korean. I went from knowing almost no Korean to being able to give a whole presentation in Korean! I learned so much and had so much fun in the process!
Learned the basics of Korean.
Full Korean alphabet and beginning conversational Korean with many conjugations
Ive learned how to introduce myself in Korean and conversational phrases.
I learn introductory skills of speaking the language of Korean along with grammatical rules and developed an appreciation for the culture.
I developed the skills and knowledge necessary for entry level conversations in korean.

By taking this course, I can honestly say that I learned so much about the Korean language, culture, food and traditions. I can say that my professor made it very enjoyable to come to class and make sure that we as students were engaged. I learned more about how to study and learn a whole new language. I learned to balance my other course while enjoying learning new language.

It's an incredible amount of Korean to learn in a semester! I feel like I could survive a conversation in Korea and maybe even figure my way out from one side of the country to the other, which I think is pretty great. Also, coming from a linguistics background it was cool having close contact with a language very different from English and actually experiencing speaking it and feeling out the morphology and syntax of what I was saying. Finally, I was forced to discover Anki which is soo good for anything in life, it really solidified my Korean knowledge and gave me the confidence to pursue learning other languages in the future!
I have learned a lot from this class. I not only learned about the Korean language but also learned about Korean culture.
Korean culture (through weekly student cultural presentations), conversational grammar and vocabulary, Hangul
Intro Korean
I learned a sufficient amount of Korean to carry out common conversations in Korean.
I learned basic Korean grammar and vocab

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: perfect course

This course was so wonderful. Professor Im and Sungu (my TF) were both so accommodating and kind, and willing to help outside of class if we needed the extra help. The class was also paced well: it moved quickly, but we had enough review to not forgot things. Moreover, Professor Im fostered a collaborative environment in our class, encouraging us to get to know one another, practice Korean together, and seek help from one another.

Strengths: 
Professor engagement with students  incredibly understanding, willing to provide help, provides critiques on reading/writing/understanding that actually help with understanding for the exams

I loved this course! The classes were well organized, engaging, and very helpful. The workbook assignments were helpful in providing more practice. The class and professor were so supportive--I felt a sense of community and belonging in this class. No weaknesses!
Super great professor and lots of good practice for conversation done in class to review the new vocabulary and sentence structures being learned

Professor Lim is the most patient teacher Ive had the fortune of taking a class with at Yale. Definitely a class to look forward to. In terms of improvement, the workbook homework assigned each week does take longer than expected, so Id find myself wanting to do my own review first than attempt the exercises.
The course was taught as a much slower pace than expected, but allowed for the students to practice the language.
The course covered many of the essential basics of the language.

The strength of this class is that  Professor Lim did his best to keep his students engaged. I can honestly say that I enjoyed coming to Professor Lim class. He gives us feedback and I am able to learn from my mistake. There was no weakness in this class

Strengths: a very well thought out curriculum - Hyunsung Lim's primary focus is actually research on how to improve teaching in classroom environments!! Also, he is very caring and overall just a great professor! Weaknesses: none that I can think of!

This course is well-structured and very engaging. 
One possible improvement might be to have weekly worksheets that summarize what we learn every week.

Strengths: Professor Lim has amazing slides and great opportunities for practice and discussion among classmates, meaning that if you participate and try to memorize the vocabulary and grammar structures during class through taking advantage of the activities, you don't have to do much studying outside of class. Lots of preparation and activities with targetted worksheets and review before the exam, meaning that I felt very prepared and supported to study rather than waste time creating my own study guides. Very accommodating to sicknesses or general absences as well as test corrections to gain some points back! An extremely fun and rewarding course:)
Professor Lim is very nice, gives lively and engaging lectures
This class is awesome as students learn Korean at a reasonable yet challenging pace. Students were given the freedom to research into Korean culture and present interesting topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100%! Best basic introduction to Korean.
Absolutely! Take it for Professor Im, the collaborative environment he fosters in class, and the fact that you learn Korean quickly while having fun.
Yes absolutely!! This class is incredible in so many ways. The professor is amazing, the class is very inclusive and welcoming, and the things we learn are super fun and engaging. I highly recommend!
Great course if you want to start learning Korean.
Definitely! Fun class to take where you can learn a lot of Korean in a low stress environment
Absolutely! I had so much fun and learned a new language
Yes, Korean is a straight forward language to learn. The course provides a general understand of the language itself along with customs of the culture.

I will recommend this course to other students because we students was able to grasp so much of the language, culture and knowledge in such a enjoyable way. This class really taught me the fundamentals of speaking Korean. I was able to share my experience and why I choose to study Korean. There is such so many benefits from taking this class.

Yes!! I was a student that, on paper, had absolutely no reason to take this course. I don't have Korean heritage, I'm not into K-Pop or K-Dramas, I just sort of vibed with the ratings of this course and the things people said about it - and I was so glad I did! Even if you're not that interested in doing anything remotely related to Korean in the future, the experience I had was very fulfilling, I was always excited to go to class and the close exposure to a language and culture that is very different from the West was very interesting!
Yes, this is a great class.

Yes! If you want to solidify your Korean knowledge, whether you're a beginner or you've picked up some Korean through media or friends, it is a very manageable Language credit and interesting class to take
Yes, a good introductory course to Korean
Yes! I think it is valuable to learn another language.
Yes, I would highly recommend this class to another student. The teachers are great and you learn a lot of fascinating aspects about both the Korean language and culture.
Yes! This was a very chill class. Lim is super nice!
